intro: Lamium parietariifolium, commonly known as wall nettle or wall lettuce, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, stinging hairs. The plant produces small, pale purple to white flowers arranged in whorls along the stems. It thrives in rocky or shaded environments, often growing on walls or in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various soil types and climatic conditions.
